title: Knowsley Works
summary: Knowsley Works - helping you to find employment
intro: Knowsley Works - helping you to find employment
text:
How Knowsley Works can help you
Knowsley residents who are unemployed and looking for employment or information on training opportunities and career development, can get help and support from the Knowsley Works team.
Services offered by Knowsley Works
Click to view some of the ways we can help you
Access to exclusive vacancies through the Employment Team
Career development support
Guidance on how to develop new and existing skills
Goal setting support
Help in preparing your CV
Help with compiling and completing application forms
Assistance with job searching
Mock interview practice
Introduction to local job opportunities
Apprenticeship opportunities
Introduction to using IT
Overcoming personal and social barriers and building confidence and motivation
Specialised support
For specialised support, the team can provide advice and guidance, and also connect you with organisations offering further support on a range of topics.
Click to view the types of specialist support you can access through Knowsley Works
Disability, learning difficulty or autism
Managing debt and finance
Mental health and well-being
Counselling services
Support groups for women
Family assistance
Enhancing numeracy and literacy
Get in touch
You can visit or call the team in Huyton, Kirkby and Halewood from Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm.

title: Meet the apprenticeship team
summary: Find out about our friendly Knowsley Apprenticeship team and the employers who have hired our apprentices.
intro: Find out about our friendly Knowsley Apprenticeship team and the employers who have hired our apprentices.
text:
Meet our advisors, Lyndsey and Mandy
Lyndsey Roberts and Mandy Haak have been helping young people find apprenticeships for over ten years.
What we do
We offer a special free service to help employers and young people find the right match. We also mentor apprentices while they're learning and help employers get funding to hire apprentices from Knowsley.
Our Impact
We've helped 1,536 young people start their apprenticeships! We're not stopping – we're here to help more.
Contact - Meet the apprenticeship team
Send us a message
0151 443 2261/ 2599

title: Case studies
summary: See some stories from those who have used Knowsley Apprentice scheme.
intro: See some stories from those who have used Knowsley Apprentice scheme.
text:
Structec Ltd
Aimee's Story
Aimee shares, "I began my apprenticeship with Structec (N.W) Ltd through the Knowsley Apprentice scheme. Thanks to their support, I've earned Level 2, 3, & 4 qualifications in Business and Administration. Today, I hold a leadership position, where I help others achieve similar goals."
Georgia's Story
Georgia says, "I successfully completed a Level 2 Business Admin apprenticeship with Structec (N.W.) Ltd, thanks to the Knowsley Apprentice scheme. The company has been incredibly supportive, especially my mentor, who understands my journey. Now, I'm excited to continue my education with a Level 3 qualification."
Citrus Group
Owen's Story
We're thrilled to introduce Owen Hankin, our very first Fire Alarm and Security Apprentice. Owen is joining our team, ready to learn and grow.
Jacob's Story
Meet Jacob Bentley, our Electrical Engineer Apprentice. Jacob completed his journey to join us, and we're excited to have him on board.
A Message from Citrus
At Citrus, the success of our apprentices is a team effort. If you have the opportunity to work with an apprentice, make it count! Offer them diverse experiences and guidance. Our apprentices have the potential to become some of our best employees, with support from Citrus colleagues like you.
Livv Housing
Claudia's Story
Claudia is our Customer Insight Apprentice at Livv Housing. She shares, "Before my apprenticeship, I wasn't sure what I wanted to do. At Livv, I've explored different areas within my department, giving me a clearer direction."
Claudia joined in September 2021 and has been thriving at Livv. She learns something new every day and values the supportive and welcoming atmosphere.
Niall's Story
Niall Walsh serves as an Assistant Property Manager at Livv Housing. He joined as an Apprentice Site Manager in 2018 at the age of 19, following his preference for hands-on work.
After 18 months, he earned the role of Assistant Property Manager, a testament to the growth he achieved through his apprenticeship journey.
Steven's Story
Steven, a Finance Advisor – Property at Livv Housing, reflects on his apprenticeship journey. "My apprenticeship not only developed my job skills but also enhanced crucial life skills like communication, time management, and teamwork. My overall confidence has grown too."
He believes apprenticeships are vital for young people, allowing them to transfer skills to their roles and daily life.
Paul's Story
Paul is our Electrical Apprentice at Livv Housing. He shares, "I'm thoroughly enjoying my apprenticeship, especially learning the fundamentals of becoming an Electrician. Every day brings something new."
Alongside the monthly support he receives from Knowsley Apprentice, Paul appreciates the welcoming team at Livv, who've made him feel like part of the family.
Mandy Manning, Learning & Development Manager
Mandy Manning, Learning & Development Manager at Livv Housing Group, emphasises their partnership with The Knowsley Apprentice, which has been key resource for nearly 15 years.
Livv's apprenticeships give local young people with the opportunity to learn while earning, developing essential skills, knowledge, and confidence. These apprenticeships have paved the way for over 170 young people to kickstart their careers.
Mandy is proud of the success rate of their apprenticeships, with many employees advancing from apprentices to leadership roles. She believes that Knowsley Apprentice's partnership is crucial in offering local youth alternative paths to education and work, eliminating the need to travel outside the borough for opportunities.
Steven A Hunt and Associates
"Last year, we had the privilege of participating in the Knowsley Apprenticeship scheme to hire a Junior Design Engineer. Thanks to this programme, we welcomed Thomas, who is now in his first year at LJMU, pursuing a Building Services Design Engineer Degree Apprenticeship."
"We greatly appreciate the support from Mandy, KMBC Young Persons Mentor. She not only promoted our vacancy in the Knowsley area but also among the young people she was assisting. This, along with an advert on the National Apprenticeship website, helped us find the right candidate."
"Knowing that the candidates referred by Mandy possessed the necessary attributes and qualifications for consideration was valuable. Equally important was the advice and guidance they received on essential employability skills."
"In addition to national government funding, the Knowsley financial incentive package proved extremely useful, especially for a smaller employer like us. It aided in covering training and mentoring expenses once Thomas joined our team."
"We appreciate that Mandy continues to monitor Thomas's progress, providing an external perspective that can help him feel comfortable in sharing any concerns."
St Albert's Catholic Primary School
Lisa Jewell, the School's Business Manager, shares, "We decided to hire an apprentice for our school office, offering a young person the chance to secure a full-time job where they can learn and earn while bringing fresh ideas to our workplace."
"The Knowsley Apprentice Team has been helpful throughout the advertising and interviewing process, providing ongoing support for both us and our apprentice."

title: Application advice
summary: Here you'll find some tips for when applying with Knowsley Apprentice.
intro: Here you'll find some tips for when applying with Knowsley Apprentice.
text:
Research the employer
Before you apply, delve into the employer offering the job. Understand their operations and the job's specifics.
Show your understanding
In your application, demonstrate your grasp of their business.
For instance: "I aspire to develop building maintenance skills, inspired by your success in securing a significant housing association contract."
Review the job description
Always read the job description before you start completing the application form. Ensure that the information you provide aligns with the job requirements.
Seek application support
For application form assistance, email
theknowsleyapprentice@knowsley.gov.uk
with 'Application Support' in the subject line.
Follow instructions
Before filling in your form, carefully read the instructions.
Take your time
Avoid rushing; take your time to prevent mistakes.
Draft your application
Prepare a draft of the application form before transferring the information. For handwritten forms, avoid errors on the original.
Neat and error-free
Ensure neat, error-free writing, and check your spelling.
Complete all sections
Answer all questions and fill all boxes/spaces.
Address employment gaps
Explain any gaps in your employment history. If you've never had a job, include examples like voluntary work or involvement with clubs or organisations.
Sell Your skills
Promote your skills, including those developed outside work, like hobbies and interests.
Keep a copy
Before submitting, make a copy for future reference if you're invited for an interview.
Seek feedback
Ask a friend or relative to review your application form before submission.

links.context: For application form assistance, emailtheknowsleyapprentice@knowsley.gov.ukwith 'Application Support' in the subject line.
